text.p: These are the leading stories in the Egyptian press on Sunday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- President Hosni Mubarak held talks with Syrian Vice President Farouq al-Shara and Foreign Minister Abdel-Halim Khaddam on developments in the Arab World and the peace process on all tracks.
- Information Minister Safwat el-Sherif says Abu Qurqas accident, where 10 copts were killed, does not mean that terrorism is back.
- Public Enterprise Minister Atef Obeid predicts in a report that seven billion pounds worth of foreign investments would pour into Egypt in the near future.
- Mubarak to receive Dutch Foreign Minister Hans Van Mierlo tomorrow evening during a one-day visit to Cairo.
- The cabinet will discuss tomorrow the developments in the peace process and results of the Davos World Economic Forum.
- The Finance Ministry says in a report that the government achieved unprecedent success in public expenditure rationalisation.
- Mubarak receives a letter from Syrian President Hafez el-Assad on Arab solidarity and peace.
- Security authorities conclude that six terrorists killed 10 copts in Abu Qurqas town, 240 km (150 miles) south of Cairo.
